        Returns:

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String code)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Authenticates the client useing OAuth 2.0. This method does not work with api_key auth. After a successful auth attempt, accessToken and refreshToken will be set. When using OAuth, this method must be called before any api calls are made
        Parameters:
        code - The code to use for the last leg of three-legged auth
        Returns:
        whether or not authentication was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • refreshAccessToken

        public boolean refreshAccessToken()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        refreshes the client's access token. This method should only be used when api_key auth is not used. After a successful refresh attempt, the accessToken and refreshToken fields will be updated to contain the new values
        Returns:
        whether or not the refresh was successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAddresses

        public Address[] getAddresses(int page,
                     int limit,
                     java.lang.String query)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        List bitcoin addresses associated with the current account
        Parameters:
        page - the page of addresses to retrieve. Can be used to page through results
        limit - the maximum number of addresses to retrieve. Can't exceed 1000
        query - string match to filter addresses. Matches the address itself and also if the use has set a ‘label’ on the address.
        Returns:
        the list of bitcoin addresses associated with the current account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • makeButton

        public com.google.gson.JsonObject makeButton(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String amount,
                                    java.lang.String currency,
                                    java.lang.String type,
                                    java.lang.String style,
                                    java.lang.String text,
                                    java.lang.String desc,
                                    java.lang.String custom,
                                    java.lang.String callbackUrl,
                                    java.lang.String successUrl,
                                    java.lang.String cancelUrl,
                                    java.lang.String infoUrl,
                                    boolean isVariablePrice,
                                    boolean includeAddress,
                                    boolean includeEmail)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new payment button, page, or iframe
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item for which you are collecting bitcoin. For example, Acme Order #123 or Annual Pledge Drive
        amount - Price as a decimal string, for example 1.23. Can be more then two significant digits if currency equals BTC.
        currency - Price currency as an ISO 4217 code such as USD or BTC. This determines what currency the price is shown in on the payment widget.
        type - One of buy_now, donation, and subscription.
        style - One of buy_now_large, buy_now_small, donation_large, donation_small, subscription_large, subscription_small, custom_large, custom_small, and none. none is used if you plan on triggering the payment modal yourself using your own button or link.
        text - Allows you to customize the button text on custom_large and custom_small styles.
        desc - Longer description of the item in case you want it added to the user’s transaction notes.
        custom - An optional custom parameter. Usually an Order, User, or Product ID corresponding to a record in your database.
        callbackUrl - A custom callback URL specific to this button. It will receive the same information that would otherwise be sent to your Instant Payment Notification URL. If you have an Instant Payment Notification URL set on your account, this will be called instead — they will not both be called.
        successUrl - A custom success URL specific to this button. The user will be redirected to this URL after a successful payment. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default success url set on the account.
        cancelUrl - A custom cancel URL specific to this button. The user will be redirected to this URL after a canceled order. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default cancel url set on the account.
        infoUrl - A custom info URL specific to this button. Displayed to the user after a successful purchase for sharing. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default info url set on the account.
        isVariablePrice - Allow users to change the price on the generated button.
        includeAddress - Collect shipping address from customer (not for use with inline iframes).
        includeEmail - Collect email address from customer (not for use with inline iframes).
        Returns:
        Json response containing the button information
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • makeButton

        public com.google.gson.JsonObject makeButton(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String amount,
                                    java.lang.String currency,
                                    java.lang.String type,
                                    java.lang.String style,
                                    java.lang.String text,
                                    java.lang.String desc,
                                    java.lang.String custom,
                                    java.lang.String callbackUrl,
                                    java.lang.String successUrl,
                                    java.lang.String cancelUrl,
                                    java.lang.String infoUrl)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new payment button, page, or iframe
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item for which you are collecting bitcoin. For example, Acme Order #123 or Annual Pledge Drive
        amount - Price as a decimal string, for example 1.23. Can be more then two significant digits if currency equals BTC.
        currency - Price currency as an ISO 4217 code such as USD or BTC. This determines what currency the price is shown in on the payment widget.
        type - One of buy_now, donation, and subscription.
        style - One of buy_now_large, buy_now_small, donation_large, donation_small, subscription_large, subscription_small, custom_large, custom_small, and none. none is used if you plan on triggering the payment modal yourself using your own button or link.
        text - Allows you to customize the button text on custom_large and custom_small styles.
        desc - Longer description of the item in case you want it added to the user’s transaction notes.
        custom - An optional custom parameter. Usually an Order, User, or Product ID corresponding to a record in your database.
        callbackUrl - A custom callback URL specific to this button. It will receive the same information that would otherwise be sent to your Instant Payment Notification URL. If you have an Instant Payment Notification URL set on your account, this will be called instead — they will not both be called.
        successUrl - A custom success URL specific to this button. The user will be redirected to this URL after a successful payment. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default success url set on the account.
        cancelUrl - A custom cancel URL specific to this button. The user will be redirected to this URL after a canceled order. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default cancel url set on the account.
        infoUrl - A custom info URL specific to this button. Displayed to the user after a successful purchase for sharing. It will receive the same parameters that would otherwise be sent to the default info url set on the account.
        Returns:
        Json response containing the button information
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendMoney

        public Transaction sendMoney(java.lang.String to,
                    java.lang.String amount,
                    java.lang.String notes)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Send bitcoins to an email address or bitcoin address.
        Parameters:
        to - An email address or a bitcoin address
        amount - A string amount that will be converted to BTC, such as ‘1’ or ‘1.234567’. Also must be >= ‘0.01’ or it will shown an error. If you want to use a different currency you can set amountString and currency_iso instead. This will automatically convert the amount to BTC and that converted amount will show in the transaction.
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        Returns:
        A Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendMoney

        public Transaction sendMoney(java.lang.String to,
                    java.lang.String amountString,
                    java.lang.String currency,
                    java.lang.String notes)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Send bitcoins to an email address or bitcoin address.
        Parameters:
        to - An email address or a bitcoin address
        amountString - A string amount that can be in any currency. If you use this with currency_iso you should leave amount blank.
        currency - A currency symbol such as USD, EUR, or ‘BTC’
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        Returns:
        A Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendMoney

        public Transaction sendMoney(java.lang.String to,
                    java.lang.String amount,
                    java.lang.String notes,
                    java.lang.String fee,
                    java.lang.String referrerId)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Send bitcoins to an email address or bitcoin address.
        Parameters:
        to - An email address or a bitcoin address
        amount - A string amount that will be converted to BTC, such as ‘1’ or ‘1.234567’. Also must be >= ‘0.01’ or it will shown an error. If you want to use a different currency you can set amountString and currency_iso instead. This will automatically convert the amount to BTC and that converted amount will show in the transaction.
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        fee - transaction fee. Coinbase pays transaction fees on payments greater than or equal to 0.01 BTC. But for smaller amounts you may want to add your own amount. Fees can be added as a string, such as ‘0.0005’.
        referrerId - id of the user to get a referral credit in the case that this transaction makes the user eligible. The referring user is eligible for a credit if the address in the ‘to’ field is an email address for which there is currently no registered account and the recipient proceeds to buy or sell at least 1 BTC.
        Returns:
        A Transaction Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendMoney

        public Transaction sendMoney(java.lang.String to,
                    java.lang.String amountString,
                    java.lang.String currency,
                    java.lang.String notes,
                    java.lang.String fee,
                    java.lang.String referrerId)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Send bitcoins to an email address or bitcoin address.
        Parameters:
        to - An email address or a bitcoin address
        amountString - A string amount that can be in any currency. If you use this with currency_iso you should leave amount blank.
        currency - A currency symbol such as USD, EUR, or ‘BTC’
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        fee - transaction fee. Coinbase pays transaction fees on payments greater than or equal to 0.01 BTC. But for smaller amounts you may want to add your own amount. Fees can be added as a string, such as ‘0.0005’.
        referrerId - id of the user to get a referral credit in the case that this transaction makes the user eligible. The referring user is eligible for a credit if the address in the ‘to’ field is an email address for which there is currently no registered account and the recipient proceeds to buy or sell at least 1 BTC.
        Returns:
        A Transaction Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • requestMoney

        public Transaction requestMoney(java.lang.String from,
                       java.lang.String amount,
                       java.lang.String notes)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Send an invoice/money request to an email address.
        Parameters:
        from - An email address to send the request
        amount - A string amount that will be converted to BTC, such as ‘1’ or ‘1.234567’. Also must be >= ‘0.01’ or it will shown an error. If you want to use a different currency you can set amountString and currency_iso instead. This will automatically convert the amount to BTC and that converted amount will show in the transaction.
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        Returns:
        A Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • requestMoney

        public Transaction requestMoney(java.lang.String from,
                       java.lang.String amountString,
                       java.lang.String currency,
                       java.lang.String notes)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Send an invoice/money request to an email address.
        Parameters:
        from - An email address to send the request
        amountString - A string amount that can be in any currency. If you use this with currency_iso you should leave amount blank.
        currency - A currency symbol such as USD, EUR, or ‘BTC’
        notes - Included in the email that the recipient receives.
        Returns:
        A Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
